blocks.name: minveclem1
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ minvec . The set of all distances from points of ` Y ` to ` A ` are a nonempty set of nonnegative reals. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.)

thm minveclem1(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {

} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0))))), wi(w0, wcel(co(c2, cress, c5), ccms)))

  a1ii(wi(w0, w3a(wss(c0, cr), wne(c0, emptycls), wral(s0, c0, wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0))))), diffsc(s1, c1))

  sylibr(w0, wral(s0, crn(cmpt(s1, c5, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1))))), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0))), wral(s1, c5, wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1))))))

  syl(w0, wcel(c2, cngp), wcel(c2, ccph))

  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s1), c5), wcel(c2, clmod))
  syl(w0, wcel(c2, clmod), wcel(c2, ccph))

  lssss(c5, cfv(clss, c2), c1, c2)
  eqid(cfv(clss, c2))
  lmodvsubcl(c2, c6, c1, cv(s1), c3)
  nmge0(c2, co(c6, c3, cv(s1)), c1, c4)
  ax-mp(wb(wral(s0, crn(cmpt(s1, c5, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1))))), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0))), wral(s1, c5, wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1)))))), wral(s1, c5, wcel(cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1))), universe)))
  rgenw(s1, c5, wcel(cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1))), universe))
  fvex(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1)))
  ralrnmpt(s1, s0, c5, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1))), universe, cmpt(s1, c5, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1)))), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0)), wbr(nat0, cle, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1)))))
  eqid(cmpt(s1, c5, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1)))))

  raleqi(s0, c0, crn(cmpt(s1, c5, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s1))))), wbr(nat0, cle, cv(s0)))
  diff.cr.s(s1)

  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(c0 ‚äÜ ‚Ñù ‚àß c0 ‚â† ‚àÖ ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c0, 0[‚â§]s0)))

  eqeq1i(dom((s1 ‚àà c5 ‚Ü¶(c4 `(c6[c3]s1)))), emptycls, c5)

blocks.name: minveclem4c
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ minvec . The infimum of the distances to ` A ` is a real number. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jun-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.) (Revised by AV, 3-Oct-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm minveclem4c(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, cr))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(csg, c2))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cnm, c2))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, ccph))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c5, cfv(clss, c2)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(co(c2, cress, c5), ccms))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c6, c1))
  -| wceq(c7, cfv(ctopn, c2))
  -| wceq(c8, crn(cmpt(s0, c5, cfv(c4, co(c6, c3, cv(s0))))))
  -| wceq(c0, cinf(c8, cr, clt))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s0, c8)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wcel(c0, cr)), diffsc(s0, c0))
  syl5eqel(c0, cr, cinf(c8, cr, clt), w0)
  syl3anc(w0, wcel(cinf(c8, cr, clt), cr), wss(c8, cr), wne(c8, emptycls), wrex(s0, cr, wral(hs0, c8, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs0)))))
  simp1d(w0, wss(c8, cr), wne(c8, emptycls), wral(hs0, c8, wbr(nat0, cle, cv(hs0))))
  simp2d(w0, wne(c8, emptycls), wss(c8, cr), wral(hs0, c8, wbr(nat0, cle, cv(hs0))))
  sylancr(w0, wrex(s0, cr, wral(hs0, c8, wbr(cv(s0), cle, cv(hs0)))), wcel(nat0, cr), wral(hs0, c8, wbr(nat0, cle, cv(hs0))))

blocks.name: minveclem2
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ minvec . Any two points ` K ` and ` L ` in ` Y ` are close to each other if they are close to the infimum of distance to ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.) (Revised by AV, 3-Oct-2020.)

blocks.name: minveclem3
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ minvec . The filter formed by taking elements successively closer to the infimum is Cauchy. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.)

blocks.name: minveclem6
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ minvec . Any minimal point is less than ` S ` away from ` A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.) (Revised by AV, 3-Oct-2020.)

blocks.name: minveclem7
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ minvec . Since any two minimal points are distance zero away from each other, the minimal point is unique. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.)

  diff.hs0.s(s1)
}

blocks.name: minvec
blocks.content: Minimizing vector theorem, or the Hilbert projection theorem. There is exactly one vector in a complete subspace ` W ` that minimizes the distance to an arbitrary vector ` A ` in a parent inner product space. Theorem 3.3-1 of [Kreyszig] p. 144, specialized to subspaces instead of convex subsets. (Contributed by NM, 11-Apr-2008.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 9-May-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 15-Oct-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 3-Oct-2020.)
